solution_line_template: Penny buys {num_pairs_socks} pairs of socks for ${price_per_pair} x {num_pairs_socks} = $<<{num_pairs_socks}*{price_per_pair}={socks_total}>>{socks_total}.
In total, Penny spent ${socks_total} + ${hat_price} = $<<{socks_total}+{hat_price}={total_spent}>>{total_spent} on {num_pairs_socks} pairs of socks and a hat.
Penny has ${initial_money} -${total_spent} = $<<{initial_money}-{total_spent}={money_left}>>{money_left} left after buying {num_pairs_socks} pairs of socks and a hat.
